experience: You and Zina both know Craig McLaughlin, Luma Dahlbacka, and 52 others
You both worked at Charles Schwab
Zina worked at Charles Schwab before you started
Senior Project Manager | Technical  Scrum Master

Successfully managed and supported multiple Product Teams across an extensive portfolio of company-wide projects focusing on web (Schwab.com), cash management, Advisor Suite Wealth Management Platform, Fraud Detection and Security, Infrastructure, marketing data solutions, Mobile, Paperless, Rep tools, Schwab Bank, Statements and Reports, Web Services, Web/Mobile Accessibility Program, involving Schwab’s cross-functional teams and extensive integration with vendor products.•	Facilitated daily scrums and release planning meetings, planned sprint backlogs with focus on estimating work effort, conducted stakeholder retrospective meetings throughout all Agile phases which included the design, development, testing and production deployment. •	  Participated in two year transition from Waterfall (RUP) to full Agile adaptation on Schwab.com. Coached and mentored teams on tools and updated release procedures.•	  Coordinated Online Transfers Redesign project – rebuilding of 25 APIs to cut maintenance cost ($1.5M yearly) and provide flexible robust approach for future development and testing.•	Led the transition of Mobile Web projects and their release management practice to Schwab.com. Transformed and formalized standards, processes and procedures for development, QA, Deployment and Production certification. Successfully installed 3 major releases in a period of 6 months vs. one release in 18 months prior to the switch. •	Implemented reverse engineering practice for the Web Accessibility Project (sight impaired clients), managing 22 web-based applications and a team of (25+) in India and three US locations. Received praise from the Product Owners on velocity and momentum, and reaching the non-negotiable compliance deadline one month ahead of schedule.

Effectively headed and oversaw all aspects of Schwab.com QA efforts including budget, capacity, Functional, Automation, Regression, End-to-End, UAT, Production Deployment and Certification.•	Coached, trained, mentored and supervised dozens of Onshore and Offshore QA Engineers joining Schwab.com QA team as a part of new outsourcing strategy.•	Wrote and published release management, QA process related and methodology documents and ‘how-to’ manuals as training materials to bring new resources up to speed. •	Lead 20 QA Engineers during Pre-Prod and Production certifications (bi-weekly releases) for the Greenfield Project (complete rewrite of the Schwab.com website from Java into .NET - $44M budget) for a period of three years.  •	Conducted Release Reviews and Milestones, Business Go/No-Go decision meetings. Published Release Readiness Report to Technology and Business SVPs and EVPs and gathered approvals and sign-offs before each Production Installation. •	Authored and published Production Certification and test data gathering guidelines according to the Internal Audit regulations and policies for all Schwab.com Lines of Business.•	Prepared and successfully passed Federal Reserve and Internal Audits Reviews without additional recommendations from auditors.
QA Engineer (End-to-End Coordinator | Systems Integration & Infrastructure)

•	Lead end-to-end QA efforts for WAS/Linux Migration on Schwab.com site with 14 domains involved simultaneously. Monitored Quality Center tool installations, created and automated quires for daily status report (70K use cases in total) - saved $7 million annually. •	Created an overall Master Test Plan, unified Quality Center usage, managed test execution, tracked and reviewed bugs, provided support and guidance to TPMs and QA Managers, produced daily status reports, led meetings on strategy and progress with senior management. •	Provided around the clock QA support for the Business Partner of eCommunications team for a month following 9/11. Required great flexibility, understanding, and focus to update our systems with frequent changes coming from a third party vendor (formerly located in the World Trade Center- Tower II). Saved $300K by meeting a strict contractual deadline.

Managed, coordinated and tested components of RACER, a solution to connect 1000+ medical practices with payers systems through coordination of administrative healthcare tasks including submission of referrals and authorizations, claims and status inquires patient eligibility, provider directory information, and secure mail.
Department Relations Business Analyst - Medical Group Business Services

Served as a liaison between MGBS and UCSF medical practices. Analyzed billing ‘trends’ to maximize reimbursement. Personally investigated, followed up and collected $100K of net revenue for the late, previously unpaid and denied medical claims in a period of one month.
Every weekend hot, nutritional meals are prepared for two large San Francisco shelters which house 200+ men, women and children.

recommendations: Stephanie Reiley
Managing Director - Schwab.com / Schwab Intelligent Portfolios / Schwab Intelligent Advisory Onboarding Applications
October 22, 2015, Zina worked with Stephanie in the same group

Zina served as the QA lead / QA program director on several key initiatives on which I was product owner at Schwab.  She is honestly one of the finest QA managers with which I've had the pleasure to work in the past two decades.  While Zina is an excellent Quality Analyst in her own right, she also an excellent manager and mentor to those analysts that reported to her.In addition to her attention to detail and rigorous discipline--which you expect from QA--Zina also has the rare talent in the world of QA of being able to think outside the box/creatively when circumstances dictated.  This helped us on many occasions when we had to figure out how to pull in the deadline on a project or approach the work in an less conventional way.I would highly recommend her for your consideration.
Stephanie Reiley

Cybersecurity
October 17, 2015, Georg worked with Zina in different groups

As a Schwab.com release manager, I worked with Zina on getting many releases deployed into production.  Zina is a senior QA lead and a scrum master and was responsible for several challenging and complex projects and was always on top of it.  Many of her projects were developed, tested and deployed in Agile fashion and her knowledge of Agile is very impressive.  She is both experienced as a scrum master and as a QA lead for Agile projects.  Some of the release deployments have been only successful because of her knowledge, team work and dedication towards her work and I am very thankful that she was part of the team.

summary: Accomplished and experienced technology leader, solution-oriented strategist and quality champion specializing in managing and delivering large scale IT projects while working with a geographically distributed workforce. Passionate and dedicated with emphasis to meet business objectives and produce great client value. Software Development Life Cycle expert well versed in Agile/SCRUM, Waterfall and RUP methodologies and processes.Analytical and collaborative, solid teamwork player, excellent written and verbal communication skills, effective motivator with ability to cultivate and grow healthy trustful relationships with Technology Teams, Product Owners, Vendors and Management at all levels.
name: Zina Okun
title: Senior Project Manager | Technical Scrum Master, CSM
